Perut siapa paling buncit?
06 Nov 2019, 22:30 by Suraya Roslan
BERJALAN seperti model sambil memperagakan perut buncit. Bunyi agak aneh tetapi itulah realiti menerusi Pertandingan Perut Buncit Bergaya yang akan diadakan awal Disember ini.
Menerusi pertandingan itu, peserta lelaki hanya perlu ‘catwalk’ bergaya, menampilkan perut buncit dan berpakaian menarik sebagai syarat utama memenangi pertandingan.
Penganjur yang juga ahli perniagaan, Alex Soh, 44, berkata, pertandingan unik itu bakal diadakan di Kompleks Sukan Beaufort, Sabah dengan sasaran penyertaan 50 orang pada 1 Disember ini.
“Lelaki perut buncit juga mahu pengiktirafan seperti pertandingan ratu cantik atau bina badan yang selalu menjadi rebutan penyertaan.
“Idea di sebalik pertandingan ini adalah bagi meraikan mereka yang mempunyai perut buncit dan wanita seharusnya bangga mempunyai pasangan seperti ini.
“Disebabkan itu saya mengadakan pertandingan unik ini bagi memberi pengiktirafan kepada mereka,” katanya ketika dihubungi.
Menurutnya, setakat ini dia menerima 10 penyertaan daripada ‘lelaki perut buncit’ dan mengharapkan lebih ramai dengan ciri-ciri sama tampil bagi memeriahkan pertandingan.
“Menggunakan tema ‘Jangan Malu, Jangan Segan’, saya mengharapkan penyertaan daripada ramai pihak terutama dari Semenanjung, setakat ini yang berdaftar dengan saya peserta sekitar Sabah saja.
“Syarat penyertaan peserta mesti berusia 30 tahun ke atas dan mempunyai perut buncit, tidak kisah saiz pinggang berapa asalkan kita boleh nampak perutnya,” katanya.


Kain rentang pertandingan perut buncit yang akan dianjurkan bulan depan. FOTO Ihsan Alex Soh

Ditanya bagaimana pemenang akan dinilai, Alex berkata, peserta diadili dua pengadil yang menilai peserta ‘catwalk’ paling bergaya, wajib mempunyai perut buncit dengan pakaian menarik.
“Peserta perlu ‘catwalk’ dengan bergaya di depan 3,000 hingga 4,000 penonton.
“Mereka yang menerima sorakan paling kuat daripada penonton juga akan menerima markah lebih dengan pakaian menarik.
“Ibaratnya seperti pertandingan ratu cantik tetapi peserta kali ini terdiri daripada lelaki perut buncit.
“Yuran penyertaan hanya RM35 dan peserta berpeluang membawa pulang wang tunai RM400 untuk tempat pertama seterusnya RM300 di tempat kedua manakala RM200 tempat ketiga diiringi sijil penyertaan,” katanya.
Katanya, pertandingan itu bakal mendapat liputan meluas dari media antarabangsa yang tertarik dengan keunikan acara itu sekali gus mengharumkan nama Malaysia.

Whose stomach is the biggest?
06 Nov 2019, 22:30 by Suraya Roslan
WALK like a model while demonstrating a belly button. It sounds a bit strange but that's the reality with the Stylish Beef Contest which will be held early December.
Through the competition, male participants only needed a stylish 'catwalk', featuring a belly button and attractive dress as the prerequisite for winning the competition.
Organizer and businessman Alex Soh, 44, said the unique competition will be held at the Beaufort Sports Complex in Sabah with a target of 50 participants on December 1.
“Retail men also want recognition like a beauty pageant or bodybuilding that has always been a staple of participation.
“The idea behind the competition is to celebrate those who have a stomach and women should be proud to have such a partner.
"That's why I held this unique competition to give them recognition," he said when contacted.
According to him, so far he has received 10 entries from the 'men's stomach' and is hoping for more with the same features coming out to boost competition.
“Using the theme 'Don't Shame, Don't Segan', I look forward to participation from many, especially from the Peninsula, so far with only participants around Sabah.
"Participants must be 30 years of age or older and have a stomach, no matter how much their waist size is as long as we can see their stomachs," he said.


A range of retail belly games will be organized next month. PHOTO Courtesy Alex Soh

Asked how the winner would be judged, Alex said the judges were judged by two judges who rated the most stylish 'catwalk' participants, who had to have a belly with attractive clothing.
“Participants need a‘ catwalk ’in style in front of 3,000 to 4,000 viewers.
“Those who receive the strongest cheers from the audience will also receive more scores with attractive outfits.
"It may look like a beauty pageant but the contestants are comprised of bearded men.
“Participation fee is only RM35 and participants are given RM400 cash for the first place and RM300 for the second place and RM200 for the third place with a certificate of participation,” he said.
He said the competition would receive widespread coverage from the international media who were drawn to the uniqueness of the event, thus honoring Malaysia's name.
